intro: Taraxacum aganophytum, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its hairy, spoon-shaped leaves and yellow composite flowers that bloom in early spring. It has a deep taproot system that allows it to survive in dry conditions. Taraxacum aganophytum is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a pioneer species in desert ecosystems.
